Legal_Issue: Reasonableness of the Board's decision on refugee status
Credibility_Assessment: Applicant initially found credible, but credibility later questioned without adequate justification
Evidence_Type: Personal testimony, travel history, family background, association with LTTE
Basis_of_Claim: Fear of persecution due to ethnicity (Tamil) and alleged association with LTTE in Sri Lanka
Key_Factor_in_Determination: State involvement in risk, individualized risk assessment
Review_Outcome: Decision set aside, case remanded for re-determination
Application_Factor: Past events, membership in particular social group, political opinion
Decision_Review_Issue: Material errors in fact-finding and procedural fairness
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Principles of procedural fairness, Charter s. 7, IRPA s. 101
Cause_of_Refusal: Perceived lack of credibility, reliance on generalized risk without state involvement
Evidentiary_Issues: Inconsistent findings, failure to address key evidence
Procedural_Fairness: Violation due to failure to properly assess evidence and provide transparent reasoning
Credibility_Issues: Inconsistent treatment of applicant’s credibility despite initial acceptance
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Challenge based on unreasonableness and procedural unfairness
Procedural_Issue: Failure to provide intelligible and transparent decision
